intro: Malva cretica subsp. althaeoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf mallows, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a serrated edge. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to ecological and ornamental horticulture.
